title: Open Radar Data Ingest Schema
description: ORD ingest schema, describes all fields available and required by data providers

title.description: short phrase or sentence describing the dataset. In many discovery systems, the title will be displayed in the results list from a search, and therefore should be human readable and reasonable to display in a list of such names. This attribute is also recommended by the NetCDF Users Guide and the CF conventions.

summary.description: A paragraph describing the dataset, analogous to an abstract for a paper.

keywords.description: A comma-separated list of key words and/or phrases. Keywords may be common words or phrases, terms from a controlled vocabulary (GCMD is often used), or URIs for terms from a controlled vocabulary (see also 'keywords_vocabulary' attribute).

keywords_vocabulary.description: If you are using a controlled vocabulary for the words/phrases in your 'keywords' attribute, this is the unique name or identifier of the vocabulary from which keywords are taken. If more than one keyword vocabulary is used, each may be presented with a prefix and a following comma, so that keywords may optionally be prefixed with the controlled vocabulary key.

instrument.description: Name of the contributing instrument(s) or sensor(s) used to create this data set or product. Indicate controlled vocabulary used in instrument_vocabulary.

instrument_vocabulary.description: Controlled vocabulary for the names used in the 'instrument' attribute.

level.description: Product parameter. PVOL, SCAN, PPI: elevation. Composite: product parameter. 'Layer height above the radar' at CAPPI, PCAPPI,  'Reflectivity level threshold' at ETOP, EBASE, 'Azumuth angle' at RHI, 'Top heights of the integration layer' at VIL

period.description: Aggregation period for the measurement. For example PVOL and SCAN: dataset/enddate - dataset/startdate. Must be provided in ISO8601 duration format. https://www.iso.org/iso-8601-date-and-time-format.html

function.description: Function used on the data during the aggregation period. Must be one of the functions given in CF cell_methods table. https://cfconventions.org/Data/cf-conventions/cf-conventions-1.7/build/ape.html

license.description: Provide the URL to a standard or specific license, enter 'Freely Distributed' or 'None', or describe any restrictions to data access and distribution in free text.

Conventions.description: A comma-separated list of the conventions that are followed by the dataset. For files that follow this version of ACDD, include the string 'ACDD-1.3'. (This attribute is described in the NetCDF Users Guide.) E-SOH require ACDD and CF attribute convetions.

naming_authority.description: The organization that provides the initial id (see above) for the dataset. The naming authority should be uniquely specified by this attribute. We recommend using reverse-DNS naming for the naming authority; URIs are also acceptable. Example: 'edu.ucar.unidata'.

history.description: Provides an audit trail for modifications to the original data. This attribute is also in the NetCDF Users Guide: 'This is a character array with a line for each invocation of a program that has modified the dataset. Well-behaved generic netCDF applications should append a line containing: date, time of day, user name, program name and command arguments.' To include a more complete description you can append a reference to an ISO Lineage entity; see NOAA EDM ISO Lineage guidance.

datetime.description: Identifies the date/time of the data being published, in RFC3339 format.

start_datetime.description: Identifies the start date/time date of the data being published, in RFC3339 format.

end_datetime.description: Identifies the end date/time date of the data being published, in RFC3339 format.

coverage_duration_datetime.description: Describes the duration of the data set. Use RFC3339 duration format.

resolution_datetime.description: Describes the targeted time period between each value in the data set. Use RFC3339 format.

source.description: The method of production of the original data. If it was model-generated, source should name the model and its version. If it is observational, source should characterize it. This attribute is defined in the CF Conventions.

platform.description: Name of the platform(s) that supported the sensor data used to create this data set or product. Platforms can be of any type, including satellite, ship, station, aircraft or other. Indicate controlled vocabulary used in platform_vocabulary.

platform_vocabulary.description: Controlled vocabulary for the names used in the 'platform' attribute.

processing_level.description: A textual description of the processing (or quality control) level of the data.

quality_code_vocabulary.description: Controlled vocabulary for the values used in the 'quality_code' attribute.

hamsl.description: The number of meters above mean sea level. The reference point is the ground position of the station for stationary data, or the sensor itself for mobile data.

creator_name.description: The name of the person (or other creator type specified by the creator_type attribute) principally responsible for creating this data.

creator_email.description: The email address of the person (or other creator type specified by the creator_type attribute) principally responsible for creating this data.

creator_url.description: The URL of the person (or other creator type specified by the creator_type attribute) principally responsible for creating this data.

object.description: Object type: Polar volume, Cartesian volume, Polar scan, Single polar ray, Azimuthal object, Elevational object, 2-D cartesian image, Cartesian composite image(s), 2-D vertical cross section(s), 1-D vertical profile, Embedded graphical image

source.description: Variable-length string containing pairs of identifier types and their values, separated by a colon.

projdef.description: The projection definition arguments, described above, which can be used with PROJ.4. See the PROJ.4 documentation for usage. Longitude/Latitude coordinates are normalized to the WGS-84 ellipsoid and geodetic datum.

xsize.description: Number of pixels in the X dimension

ysize.description: Number of pixels in the Y dimension

zsize.description: Number of vertical layers. Only used for three-dimensional products.

xscale.description: Pixel size in the X dimension, in projection-specific coordinates

yscale.description: Pixel size in the Y dimension, in projection-specific coordinates

ztop.description: Layer top heights above mean sea level. The size of this one-dimensional array corresponds with the number of vertical layers. Only used for three-dimensional products.

zbottom.description: Layer bottom heights above mean sea level. The size of this one-dimensional array corresponds with the number of vertical layers. Only used for three-dimensional products.

LL_lat.description: Latitude of the lower left corner of the lower left pixel

LL_lon.description: Longitude of the lower left corner of the lower left pixel

UL_lat.description: Latitude of the upper left corner of the upper left pixe

UL_lon.description: Longitude of the upper left corner of the upper left pixel

UR_lat.description: Latitude of the upper right corner of the upper right pixel

UR_lon.description: Longitude of the upper right corner of the upper right pixel

LR_lat.description: Latitude of the lower right corner of the lower right pixel

LR_lon.description: Longitude of the lower right corner of the lower right pixel

extension.description: Name of the extensions of /what/version Name of the acquisition task or product

task.description: Name of the acquisition task or product generator

elangle.description: Antenna elevation angle above the horizon

nbins.description: Number of range bins in each ray

rstart.description: The range of the start of the first range bin

rscale.description: The distance between two successive range bins

nrays.description: Number of azimuth or elevation gates (rays) in the object

a1gate.description: Index of the first azimuth gate radiated in the scan

startaz.description: The azimuth angle of the start of the first gate in the sector [degrees]

stopaz.description: The azimuth angle of the end of the last gate in the sector [degrees]

startel.description: The elevation angle of the start of the first gate in the sector [degrees]

stopel.description: The elevation angle of the end of the last gate in the sector [degrees]

sw_version.description: Software version in string format, e.g. “5.1” or “8.11.6.2”

zr_a.description: Z-R constant a in Z = a Rb , applicable to any product containing reflectivity or precipitation data

zr_b.description: Z-R exponent b in Z = a Rb , applicable to any product containing reflectivity or precipitation data

kr_a.description: KDP -R constant a in R = a*KDP^b

simulated.description: True” if data are simulated, otherwise “False”.

antspeed.description: Antenna speed (positive for clockwise and ascending, negative for counter-clockwise and descending) [degrees/s]

RXbandwith.description: Bandwidth that the receiver is set to when operating the radar with the above mentioned pulsewidth

prt.description: Pulse repetition time. For staggered prt, also see prt_ratio. The size of this one-dimensional array corresponds with the value of where/nrays for that dataset.

prt_ratio.description: Ratio of prt/prt2. For dual/staggered prt mode. The size of this one-dimensional array corresponds with the value of where/nrays for that dataset.

TXlossH.description: Total loss in the transmission chain for horizontally-polarized signals, defined as the losses that occur between the calibration reference plane and the feed horn, inclusive

TXlossV.description: Total loss in the transmission chain for vertically-polarized signals, defined as the losses that occur between the calibration reference plane and the feed horn, inclusive

injectlossH.description: Total loss between the calibration reference plane and the test signal generator for horizontally-polarized signals

injectlossV.description: Total loss between the calibration reference plane and the test signal generator for vertically-polarized signals

RXlossH.description: Total loss in the receiving chain for horizontally-polarized signals, defined as the losses that occur between the antenna reference point and the receiver, inclusive.

RXlossV.description: Total loss in the receiving chain for vertically-polarized signals, defined as the losses that occur between the antenna reference point and the receiver, inclusive

radomelossH.description: One-way dry radome loss for horizontally-polarized signals

radomelossV.description: One-way dry radome loss for vertically-polarized signals

gasattn.description: Gaseous specific attenuation assumed by the radar processor (zero if no gaseous attenuation is assumed)

radconstH.description: Radar constant for the horizontal channel.

radconstV.description: Radar constant for the vertical channel

nomTXpower.description: Nominal transmitted peak power at the output of the transmitter (magnetron/klystron output flange)

TXpower.description: Transmitted peak power at the calibration reference plane. The values given are average powers over all transmitted pulses in each azimuth gate. The size of this one-dimensional array corresponds with the value of where/nrays for that dataset

powerdiff.description: Power difference between transmitted horizontally and vertically-polarized signals at the the feed horn

phasediff.description: Phase difference between transmitted horizontally and vertically-polarized signals as determined from the first valid range bins

Vsamples.description: Number of samples used for radial velocity measurements

scan_index.description: Which scan this is in the temporal sequence (starting with 1) of the total number of scans comprising the volume

scan_count.description: The total number of scans comprising the volume

astart.description: Azimuthal offset from 0◦ of the start of the first ray in the sweep. This value is positive where the gate starts clockwise after 0◦, and it will be negative if it starts before 0◦. In either case, the value must be no larger than half a ray’s width

azmethod.description: How raw data in azimuth are processed to arrive at the given value

elmethod.description: How raw data in elevation are processed to arrive at the given value

binmethod.description: How raw data in range are processed to arrive at the given value

azmethod_avg.description: How many original data elements in range are averaged to arrive at the given value

institution.description: The name of the institution principally responsible for originating this data. This attribute is recommended by the CF convention.

project.description: The name of the project(s) principally responsible for originating this data. Multiple projects can be separated by commas, as described under Attribute Content Guidelines. Examples: 'PATMOS-X', 'Extended Continental Shelf Project'.

creator_type.description: Specifies type of creator with one of the following: 'person', 'group', 'institution', or 'position'. If this attribute is not specified, the creator is assumed to be a person.

content.description: Used to embed small products inline within the message.

size.description:
Number of bytes contained in the file. Together with the ``integrity`` property, it provides additional assurance that file content was accurately received.
Note that the limit takes into account the data encoding used, including data compression (for example `gzip`).

value.description: Direct link to the data file.

standard_name.description: ODIM quantity names, for the data included in this message.

links.description: This section contains links relevant for the timeseries. A link to the data providers data services where the entire timeseries can be downloaded is encouraged.
